# Load Dataset
```{python}
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
wdi = pd.read_csv("wdi.csv")
print(wdi.columns)
```

# Exploratory data analysis
```{python}
# Calculate average inflation rate
avg_inflation = wdi['inflation_rate'].mean()
print("The average inflation rate is:", avg_inflation)

# Calculate average GDP growth
avg_gdp_growth = wdi['gdp_growth_rate'].mean()
print("The average GDP growth rate is:", avg_gdp_growth)

# Measure the highest unemployment rate
max_unemployment = wdi['unemployment_rate'].max()
print("The highest unemployment rate is:", max_unemployment)
```

# Visualizations

```{python}
#| fig-width: 4
#| fig-height: 3
#| fig-align: center
#| echo: false
#| fig-cap: "Top 10 Countries by GDP Growth Rate Source: [@worldbank]"
#| label: fig-1
#| fig-env: figure
#| fig-pos: H
# Top GDP growth by countries bar chart
top_gdp = wdi.sort_values(by='gdp_growth_rate', ascending=False).head(10)
plt.figure()
plt.bar(top_gdp['country'], top_gdp['gdp_growth_rate'], color='skyblue')
plt.title('Top 10 Countries by GDP Growth Rate')
plt.xticks(fontsize=6, rotation=45)
plt.xlabel('Country')
plt.ylabel('GDP Growth Rate (%)')
plt.show()
```

```{python}
#| fig-width: 4
#| fig-height: 3
#| fig-align: center
#| echo: false
#| fig-cap: "Inflation Rate vs Unemployment Rate: [@worldbank]"
#| label: fig-2
#| fig-env: figure
#| fig-pos: H
# Scatter plot of inflation rate vs unemployment rate
plt.figure()
plt.scatter(wdi['inflation_rate'], wdi['unemployment_rate'], alpha=0.5,color = 'orange')
plt.title('Inflation Rate vs Unemployment Rate')
plt.xlabel('Inflation Rate (%)')
plt.ylabel('Unemployment Rate (%)')
plt.show()

```
